Order draws objects

Source: R/order_draws.R
order_draws.Rd

Order draws objects according to iteration and chain number. By default, draws objects are ordered but subsetting or extracting parts of them may leave them in an unordered state.

order_draws(x, ...)

# S3 method for draws_matrix
order_draws(x, ...)

# S3 method for draws_array
order_draws(x, ...)

# S3 method for draws_df
order_draws(x, ...)

# S3 method for draws_list
order_draws(x, ...)

Arguments

x

An R object for which the methods are defined.
...

Arguments passed to individual methods (if applicable).

Examples

x <- as_draws_array(example_draws())
# manually select some iterations and chains
(x <- x[10:5, 4:3, ])
#> # A draws_array: 6 iterations, 2 chains, and 10 variables
#> , , variable = mu
#> 
#>          chain
#> iteration     4   3
#>        10  3.81 8.9
#>        9   0.88 8.9
#>        8   4.90 3.5
#>        7  11.82 3.7
#>        6   2.38 1.1
#> 
#> , , variable = tau
#> 
#>          chain
#> iteration    4    3
#>        10  2.7 5.96
#>        9  15.8 5.96
#>        8   3.1 0.52
#>        7   4.3 1.68
#>        6   2.3 2.70
#> 
#> , , variable = theta[1]
#> 
#>          chain
#> iteration     4    3
#>        10  7.52 13.1
#>        9   9.07 13.1
#>        8   1.50  3.7
#>        7  18.87  5.2
#>        6   0.59  5.0
#> 
#> , , variable = theta[2]
#> 
#>          chain
#> iteration    4   3
#>        10  4.3 4.7
#>        9  11.6 4.7
#>        8   6.1 4.1
#>        7  13.0 4.1
#>        6   1.1 4.3
#> 
#> # ... with 1 more iterations, and 6 more variables
# reorder iteration and chain indices
order_draws(x)
#> # A draws_array: 6 iterations, 2 chains, and 10 variables
#> , , variable = mu
#> 
#>          chain
#> iteration     3     4
#>         5 -0.03  5.48
#>         6  1.06  2.38
#>         7  3.67 11.82
#>         8  3.51  4.90
#>         9  8.85  0.88
#> 
#> , , variable = tau
#> 
#>          chain
#> iteration     3    4
#>         5 11.03  3.0
#>         6  2.70  2.3
#>         7  1.68  4.3
#>         8  0.52  3.1
#>         9  5.96 15.8
#> 
#> , , variable = theta[1]
#> 
#>          chain
#> iteration    3     4
#>         5  8.2 -0.91
#>         6  5.0  0.59
#>         7  5.2 18.87
#>         8  3.7  1.50
#>         9 13.1  9.07
#> 
#> , , variable = theta[2]
#> 
#>          chain
#> iteration   3    4
#>         5 3.2  3.2
#>         6 4.3  1.1
#>         7 4.1 13.0
#>         8 4.1  6.1
#>         9 4.7 11.6
#> 
#> # ... with 1 more iterations, and 6 more variables
